headline: Awesome Chicken Noodle Soup
description: Homemade stock from boiled chicken gives this soup robust flavor, along with aromatics and a bit of lemongrass too. It's good for what ails you!

video.description: See how to make an amazing chicken noodle soup.
video.name: Awesome Chicken Noodle Soup

name: Awesome Chicken Noodle Soup
recipeIngredient: 1 (4 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces
0.33333334326744 bunch celery with leaves, sliced, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken into a large stockpot and pour in water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer, skimming fat as needed, for 30 minutes. Add whole carrots, whole celery, onion half, lemongrass, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Cover and simmer for 1 hour; chicken should no longer be pink at the bone and the juices should run clear. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Transfer chicken to a platter and let sit until cool enough to handle. Strain stock, discarding solids.

Return strained stock to the pot and set over high heat. Stir in sliced carrots, sliced celery (not the leaves), and chicken base. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until carrots are tender, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, remove and discard skin from cooled chicken. Chop meat into bite-sized pieces.
Add noodles and celery leaves to the pot; simmer until noodles are tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Stir in chicken and cook until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Started with one carton of chicken broth and one carton of veggie stock and two cartons of water to equal one gallon. Added the whole chicken, 3 onions, celery, 4 bay leaves, salt and pepper. Cooked it for 30 minutes, removed chicken to cool and added carrots and a celery leaves. Once cooled I removed all the chicken and added it to the pot. Add salt if needed. Cooked pasta separately and topped it with parm cheese.
Very solid recipe!

This was easy and good but I felt like it was missing something. It just didn’t have a deep enough flavor for my taste. That being said, it’s the perfect soup if your not feeling well or you want a mild soup. I would definitely make this again but I think I would use less water in hopes of a richer, deeper broth.

This was great! Honestly I don’t like reading reviews that don’t follow the recipe. I did use a left over rotisserie chicken from Costco . I followed all the direction except boiling the chicken for 30 min. Delicious
i made mine different but it came out good
Followed exactly. Turned out great!

I cook my chicken then let it sit and skim the broth into a bowl. While Chicken is cooling I saute' all the veggies in the dutch pot with the bay leaves. Then Add 1 Cup of Dry Sherry let it simmer in the veggies then add the stock, salt, pepper, basil, oregano, tyme, rosemary and bay leafs..simmer for 1 hour its freaking amazing!

I liked this recipe a lot and I made it following the recipe. The only reason I did not give this 5 stars was that after all of the time and work to make this, it tasted a lot like Panera's Chicken Noodle soup. I will make it again because it lasts and freezes well. I also like being able to make this with my own fresh, organic ingredients. The fresh organic chicken was moister and tasted fresher than Panera's chicken.
Good basic recipe for chicken noodle soup! Broth was light and flavorful. I used the lemongrass.

I followed this recipe exactly, including the lemongrass. After 2.5 hours in the kitchen I was sorely disappointed. My house smelled great, the soup looked good...but it had no flavor. I was looking for a traditional chicken noodle soup, no exciting ingredient or flavor, just the basic soup we all know and love that's stood the test of time. I couldn't believe how utterly tasteless this highly reviewed recipe was! Save yourself the time and try a different recipe because this one was a total flop!
This recipe is okay. Kinda bland, next time I will leave out the lemon grass. I have tried other recipes with better outcome.
Great recipe! And the lemongrass was worth going back to the store for, its subtle but gives a nice flavor.
Great recipe! And the lemongrass was worth going back to the store for, its subtle but gives a nice flavor.
I only used a pint of water....I like a thicker heartier creamier soup
I didn't add lemon grass and instead added some dill weed. Home made noodles really brought it together. Best chicken noodle soup I have had.

Can't beat homemade chicken noodle soup. I used homemade chicken broth (saved up the chicken broth after baking whole chickens). Great recipe. The only thing I did different was use a teaspoon of terragon.
Made is exactly as the recipe said and it was the very best chicken noodle soup ever.
Loved it!
Yes I added spinach with the noodles and celery leaves also garlic cloves to the mierqua

Needed a recipe at 2:45 pm this afternoon. I found this and started at 3:00pm. Soup was done at 5:10pm My only changes were two Knorr's Chicken Bouillon Cubes, they're are what I use, some garlic powder. No lemongrass in the kitchen, but it turned out excellent :D Very, very easy.

Wonderful soup! I followed the directions - only change was instead of lemongrass ( which I didn’t have) I used star anise, which my mother always used when making chicken noodle soup... adds a lovely flavour too. Yes, it takes time... but it’s worth it!

I will definitely make this again! I followed another reviewers recommendations to make it a bit easier and faster - chicken breasts cooked in low sodium chicken broth, then added veggies, etc to complete the recipe.

This soup takes a little time but is well worth the wait. I used 2 Knorr Homestyle Chicken Stock tubs instead of bouillon. You can always add another if you want more flavor. I also used Reamers frozen egg noodles instead of dry. I cook them separate and put the noodles in the bowls then ladle the soup over the noodles. That way the noodles don't soak up all the liquid in the pot

This is THE chicken soup recipe. I don't change a thing and have made this about once a month through the fall and winter for years. I use either chicken quarters or thighs, they are easier to bone than whole chicken. I also use kluski noodles, they don't fall apart as easy as other noodles.
It is really yummy and added more bouillon cubes
Followed directions to the letter and is now a new family favorite.
I made it to the letter and it was the most delicious chicken soup I’ve ever tasted! Next time I think I’m going to sub the noodles with some Yukon gold potatoes.

I used this recipe as a guide. I cooked my boneless skinless chicken breasts in purchased chicken broth, then shredded it. Separately, I sauteed the veggies, added broth and noodles. Cooked the noodles in the broth. Lastly, added shredded chicken until it was warmed. Fam loved it!

Yes I turned out great - I didn’t have a whole chicken so I used just the carcass and 2 large drums sticks - I didn’t have whole pepper corn so I used cracked pepper. I halved the recipe really less water and 2 stock cubes and I did add a teaspoon full of salt - everything else was the same my noodle were gluten free pre cooked and frozen which I added later and it worked so nicely - I will make it again for sure I loved it and its going to be better tomorrow I’m sure

Easy and delish! Only thing I did different was add the noodles as soon as the soup came to a boil after adding the veggies because I don’t like the veggies really soft/mushy. The recipe called for adding the noodles after the veggies had been simmering for 10 min and I felt that if the veggies were to boil for the additional time after already simmering the 10 min to allow for cooking the noodles, they would’ve been mushy. With the modification, the veggies and noodles came out perfect!

This was good chicken noodle soup. I added more bay leaves and less chicken cubes. Went to Walmart, didn't have lemongrass (duh) so I skipped that. Added a little more noodles. Not the best I've ever had, but still good. :)
Awesome!
Loved the taste! I used thin spaghetti noodles. I would cut the carrots and celery before putting the in the soup to cook instead of whole vegetables.
Love this. Simple chicken soup. I added some barley for "chewiness" but the rest stayed the same. Fabulous
I made this twice using spinach and egg noodles and omitting the lemon grass. My husband loved it and said not to change a thing.

I cooked the noodles separate, used lemon pepper and lemon juice in place of lemon grass. I thought it was a little bland and added thyme as another reviewer suggested, that made a huge difference. Definitely better with thyme.
Great Recipe, my first time making SOUP, it came great---I used 4 lbs of Chicken Breast, and could not find Lemon Grass... Other than that I stuck to the recipe and everyone loved it!!

This is a terrific authentic chicken noodle soup. Having a very broad depth of flavor of the disposable vegetables, the true chicken broth, finished with more delicious vegetables. Really, the only thing I did different was to boil my noodles before they were incorporated into the soup and to add about 3/4 of a teaspoon of sea salt (no Iodine needed). A firm artisan bread slice moderately thick was a perfect addition to this beautiful Jewish Penicillin! Perfect

Absolutely delicious!!!!! I used a Costco whole cooked chicken that I had we had only eaten the Brest meat. and didn't add the lemon grass ( because I didn't have any) . I followed the recipe it was awesome!!!! Thank you
very good! I made it as written and added one large chopped yellow potato. quick and easy soup
I was unfamiliar with the lemon grass. I found it at International Market. The flavor was good but it needs to be pulled out before eating! The vegetable should be done last as they cook so quickly!

worst directions ever! I added the bullion powder when the recipe says to add chopped carrots and celery??? I also kept the cooked carrots and celery because we like veg in this family and just chopped em up and added it in the pot. The recipe turned out pretty good in spite of the directions being terrible.

Very good. The way the recipe reads it appears they want you to throw away the whole carrots and celery when straining the chicken? Why waste! I simply chopped them up and put them back into the pot. Also added extra bay leaf.
My husband and I like spicy things so for our portions I added some cooked chorizo, squeeze of lime and a dollop of greek yogurt.
Delicious and easy to make. The only tweak I made was that I removed the skin from the chicken prior to the first step.

This was the first time I ever made chicken soup and I loved i! The only changes I made was that I used chicken broth instead of water and boullion powder. I did not use the lemongrass. I made the noodles separately and then added so they would not absorb too much liquid.

Delicious recipe! It has such a good flavor. The only changes i made is that I don't add the celery leaves or lemon grass and only use 1/8 cup chicken bouillon. I've made it twice now and it's so good! It also freezes really well.
Keeping the noodles in the soup makes them mushy! Keep them separated and add some bok choy
AWESOME! Just what the doctor ordered for flu season! My changes were to use chicken thighs, farfalle, and sweet marjoram. Thanks for sharing ALANK!
The flavor was good but seems a little crazy to make a stock from scratch and then add that much bullion. The bullion overwhelms the delicate notes of the stock and lemon grass.

Excellent taste - the lemon grass adds another dimension that is not overstated. I did not add the chicken bouillon but instead used chicken stock (primarily because I used less than a gallon of water because of the pot size). Like other comments, I prepared the noodles separately. Overall a very tasty chicken soup.
I made this dish last night for family and it was a hit. This recipe is a keeper.
Yum. Just what the doctor ordered!
To complicated and had no flavor.
I made it and my family loved it.

This recipe is very tasty I really liked the lemongrass on it! 
It is also fun to make
I add about 5 chicken bullion cubes for some extra flavor and it's excellent.mi always get a ton of compliments when I make this. Thank you for sharing your recipe!

Good recipe, will make again. Followed the recipe with one exception I could not locate Lemon grass in our market. No where in the recipe did it mention adding salt to the broth. It was very bland with out the salt, which I added along with pepper. I discovered, although others mentioned it) not to cook the noodle in the broth. I cooked the noodles separately from the soup, but had to put them in the pot as it was being served at a church pot luck. They tasted great although they were very large. Received good complements from those in attendance. A definite keeper.

Started with one carton of chicken broth and one carton of veggie stock and two cartons of water to equal one gallon. Added the whole chicken, 3 onions, celery, 4 bay leaves, salt and pepper. Cooked it for 30 minutes, removed chicken to cool and added carrots and a celery leaves. Once cooled I removed all the chicken and added it to the pot. Add salt if needed. Cooked pasta separately and topped it with parm cheese.
Great home style chicken noodle soup!! I have made this several times, and the recipe is very versatile. Add more veggies or chicken to make it heartier. Great for warming you up on a winter day.

I made this soup based and its good reviews and my husband and I loved it! I cooked the noodles separately as per some suggestions and used drum sticks in lieu of a whole chicken. Will definitely be making it again for my family, this one's a keeper!
Delicious! So yummy and we had so much for leftovers! Its a little time consuming but so worth it in the end. Even my husband who claims not to be a soup eater, loves it!
I really loved thia for a a traditional healthy chicken soup. I did use more chicken for a stronger broth plus substitited half of the water for chicken broth.
I do not add even half of the noodles in the recipe. The first time I put the original amount of noodles in, they sucked up all my broth!

Used chicken broth instead of bullion cubes. Added 1 teaspoon of vegetable oil to broth. Cooked chicken in broth. Cooked noodles separately from broth. 
Didn't have lemongrass. Will try to add next time. 
Added a couple of cilantro leaves when serving.
This (with the exception of lemon grass) is exactly my chicken noodle soup I make My family LOVE it. Its 50 degrees out side but its nice and warm in here.
Easy and Delicious!

This was the first time I made homemade chicken soup...and it was amazing! The recipe is very simple, and tasted great. I used 64 ozs. organic chicken broth and 64 ozs. water. The broth was so flavorful. I also used brown rice noodles in place of egg noodles and my kids loved it.

I am a bit of a cooking newbie, so I floundered a bit navigating this recipe. But the end results were superb. So I will share some notes in case other beginners want some tips. First of all, I cut up, skinned and trimmed the chicken in the first step, whereas the directions intend you to just cut the chicken, leaving the skinning and trimming for after it's boiled. Honestly, I thought it worked great the way I did it, and will probably do it that way again. (There is a video on here showing you how to cut up a whole chicken, I followed that.) As others mentioned, I boiled the chicken and the stock veggies (the first, uncut, set of veggies) the night before. In the morning, I scooped the veggies out and trashed them, using a mesh strainer. This was very easy, and I had very little skin, fat or anything else to skim. I was able to pull meat easily off of the bones. For the soup, you do use a new set of veggies, which was confusing for me until I read other reviews. These veggies you will want to cut to the size you will want to eat them in your soup. I did, from other recipes I've used in the past, add a few seasonings to the soup: 1 TBSP each of poultry seasoning, celery salt, garlic paste (refrigerated concoction I buy in a tube in the deli and refrigerate) and kosher salt. My family likes strong flavors and salty soups. We added the noodles later. We froze a bunch in individual sized bowls for school lunches, my kids are very happy. Thanks so much for this!
Tastes awesome, only thing I did different was to not add the bouillon, instead I let the stock simmer and reduce after I filtered it and added some thyme, salt, and pepper to season the stock.
This is a staple in our house.
The recipe called for lemongrass but I didn't have any so I used some ginger and cilantro leaves. It tasted great!

OMGosh!! The best soup ever!!! I have always wanted a great chicken noodle soup recipe and now I've found it!!! The family loved it too! My husband can't stop talking about how good it was!! Thank you ALANK for an awesome recipe!!!!

This has to be one of the easiest and most flavorful chicken noodle soups I've made. I used No Yolks noodles rather then egg noodles, and Better Than Bouillon paste instead of granules, but did everything else as written. The way the ingredients are listed threw me the first time I made the soup, I didn't realize I'd need two pounds of carrots total. My husband's favorite soup is chicken noodle but he has become sensitive to all the salt in canned soup. He likes Panera's, but finds he's at the mercy of whoever is ladling it out as to whether it's brothy or chock full'o chicken and noodles. He loves how full of meat, veggies and noodles this soup is. I make this often through the Fall and Winter.
Delicious! Great as is or sometimes I add mushrooms and top with cilantro and chili sauce.
I make this recipe a lot. It is a very good base. I usually use chicken stock and add more carrots and celery. Everyone raves about this chicken noodle soup. Even my Grandma loves it :)

I did try this recipe it was close to my own. I didn't add the lemon grass and I boiled the chicken pieces without the carrots onion and carrots. The reason being is when I strain it not only do I have to sort the chicken but now I have to try not to waste the veggies amongst the bones and skin.So while the chicken is cooking I cook the carrots onions and celery in another pot with a few veggie or chicken bouillon cubes. The veggies are only par cooked at this point and can be added back to the chicken broth with the chicken and they will cook the rest of the way. Cooking the noodles separate is a must unless you like no broth because they will soak it all up, trial and error. I read quite a few reviews and everybody's ideas were very good and helpful!
Love it! And the lemongrass was hard to find, but so worth it.
YUM!
This recipe is AMAZING! My family loves this soup and won't eat any other kind anymore. Fantastic flavor. This is always requested by extended family.
i did not add the the egg noddles and instead i added angles nest and it still was amazing . it took a little bit longer for the noodles to become the rite temp. but it still was amazing
Don't leave out the lemon grass- it gives it a freshness and depth of flavor. I added ginger as another reviewer recommended --WOW! Better than mom or even grandma ever made!
Good. Halved the recipe to fit our pot. Thanks to others' comments - cook noodles seperate and only add noodles to soup that will be eaten. Store noodles seperately.
Found it pleasantly light and tasty especially as a noon meal. Added about 1 1/2 cup of thin spaghetti 2nd time I made this recipe as a substitute noodle which was nice change of pace.
lemongrass is the secret ingredient!
I made this soup and found it to be tasty and classic. My husband really liked it and he us hard to please! I made it with celery flakes rather than real celery...still came out awesome! Thank you!
I added a cup of rice and abouthalf the amount of noodles. Delish!
Worth the effort. Very meaty and delicious. I will make again.
I'm not a big fan of Chicken Noodle Soup but I really think the Chicken Base really makes a big difference it gave it a buttery taste! Very Good!
Made it exactly as instructed and it came out great and flavorful. I didn't add lemongrass and it was ok, because it felt like something my grandmother would make.

Ok, all I want to know is who has been peeping in my kitchen window. I just happen to be skimming and I said, "Hey, that's my soup"!!!!!!! This is one of my ALL time favorite dishes year round. I did not have to make it to rate it! It is exactly how I make my soup but with out the lemon grass; however, I will be trying the lemon grass.
Delicious
A very nice soup for dinner time we all loved it .Now it has become one of favorite chicken soup.Thanks for the recipe.
This turned out absolutely perfect! The only different thing I did was use 6 Tbsp. Organic Better than Bouillon instead of the dry stuff.
Like big G's but better. We used legs and thighs. Very tasty. Big G likes this recipe. Make again.

Absolutely Wonderful. I have made this three times. The first two times was short on time so I used boxed Chicken Broth. Made this Sunday (6 degrees - wind chill -16 & snowing)so had all day to make the broth. There is a world of difference!!! I made it exactly like the recipe, except I didn't have the lemon grass so I put in about 4 Tablespoons of bottled lemon juice, I used skinless chicken breasts & cooked the noodles separate & added at the dinner table. My 83 year old mother couldn't get enough!!! To get a compliment out of her is like pulling a child's 1st tooth!
a little bland but original recipe is a good place to start.

I like the recipe but I made changes to suit me. After doing the first step exactly but i haded fresh herbs (thyme,tarragon,parsley) and 20 peppercorns and of course the carrots, bay leaves and a few smashed garlic cloves by on lemon grass or celery bc i dont like it. After straining it when returning it to the pot i added the boullion, carrots and i added peeled cut potatoes and the other half of onion finely chopped. They disappear and leave great flavor. The rest i follow the recipe.

This makes a DELICIOUS broth! I do not use the lemon grass. I strain this broth repeatedly using a cheese cloth in my fine mesh strainer until it runs absolutely clear. I also use cheese tortellini in place of the egg noodles!
So awesome on a cold winter night!!! Or when ur sick!...Delicious!!!
